intro: Triachyrum cordofanum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette structure. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
